content.content:
`.procedures`

Procedures provides automation to the commerce operation,
working with triggers to run tasks automatically

Use the **procedures** resource to create, read, update and delete
automatic tasks in a merchant's store

meta.description: Procedure title - Max length: **70**
Short procedure description in plain text - Max length: **255**
List of events that call this procedure - Min elements: **1** - Max elements: **20**
Method (HTTP verb) of the event, if undefined will match any method
Type of action taken, if undefined will match any action
API resource
Resource ID, if specified - RegEx pattern: **`^[a-f0-9]{24}$`**
Subresource slug (which appears in the URL), if specified - Max length: **30** - RegEx pattern: **`^[a-z_]+$`**
Subresource ID, if specified - RegEx pattern: **`^[a-f0-9]{24}$`**
Property created or updated with the event, if undefined will match any fields - Max length: **50** - RegEx pattern: **`^[a-z0-9_]+$`**
Conditions to continue with the procedure, based on trigger body - Max elements: **20**
Body property to compare (variable), use dot notation for nested objects - Max length: **100** - RegEx pattern: **`^[a-z0-9_]+(([.][a-z0-9_]+){1,3})?$`**
Conditional operator
Numeric value to compare with field value - Mininum: **0** - Maximum: **999999999999** - Max precision: **0.00001**
String value to compare with field, use if operator is "`str_equal`" or "`str_not_equal`" - Max length: **50**

List of notifications to be sent when this procedure is called. In some properties you can use variables from trigger object with `(tr.*)` notation, eg.: `(tr.body.name)` - Min elements: **1** - Max elements: **20**
API where notification should be sent - Min properties: **1** - Max properties: **1**
Use this property if webhook is to store API (api.e-com.plus)
API endpoint, such as /products.json, you can also include variables - Max length: **255** - RegEx pattern: **`^[/][\w$+()./]+[.]json$`**
API version
Use this property if webhook is to any external API (not api.e-com.plus)
Full URL to external API endpoint, you can also use variables here - Max length: **255** - Format: **uri**
List of headers to be sent on the request - Max elements: **20**
Header field name, eg.: X-Access-Token - Max length: **50** - RegEx pattern: **`^[A-Za-z0-9-]+$`**
Header field value, you can also use variables here - Max length: **1024**
Method (HTTP verb) to send request
Send body on notification, if true and `map_body` undefined, trigger body will be sent
Object to send, it is possible to use variables as properties values
Tag to identify object, use only lowercase letters, digits and underscore - Max length: **20** - RegEx pattern: **`^[a-z0-9_]+$`**
Flags to associate additional info - Max elements: **10**
Flag title
Optional notes with additional info about this procedure - Max length: **255**

content.content:
*/procedures.json?[field]* > Authentication
_GET_: **required** Pagination and ordering are not available, but you can use any other parameter, such as `tag` or `triggers.resource` (with [dot notation](https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/core/document/#dot-notation)), to query by particular object properties Returns only `title` and `short_description` of each procedure

meta.description: Object property to query
meta.title: string

content.content:
*/procedures.json* > Authentication
_POST_: **required** Request body must obey the specifications of [this model](#reference/procedures/procedure-object) In some properties you can use variables as value: - `(tr.*)` to get values from trigger object - eg.: `(tr.body.name)`

*/procedures/[_id].json* > Authentication
_GET_, _PATCH_, _DELETE_: **required** In read requests, response body will follow [this model](#reference/procedures/procedure-object) For editing, request body must obey the same specifications, but in this case there are no required fields

meta.description: The procedure ID
meta.title: string

meta.description: The procedure ID
meta.title: string

meta.description: The procedure ID
meta.title: string
